resources.string: Ask questions, submit bug reports / ideas
Your version of MediaMonkey for Windows is outdated.
Google Play Store not found. Desired application cannot be installed.
Ventis Media, Inc. End-User License Agreement for MediaMonkey
This feature is available on a trial basis. Days remaining:
Another instance of MediaMonkey was detected on this device. Please uninstall the other MediaMonkey applications to ensure that only one instance of MediaMonkey is installed.
This version of MediaMonkey for Android requires Google Play Services %1$s or higher. Please update to the latest version.
The Folder Browser can be used on a trial basis.
UPnP/DLNA/Casting can be used on a trial basis.
Home screen customization is a Pro feature.
Wi-Fi Sync can be used on a trial basis.
Lyric lookup can be used on trial basis.
Unlocks UPnP/DLNA streaming and UPnP/DLNA/Chromecast casting.
Unlocks home screen customization, folder browser.
Please update MediaMonkey Pro to version %1$s or higher to unlock all extra features.
Please install MediaMonkey Pro to unlock all extra features.
This action isn\'t supported for unknown items.
Finish playing the current track when timer ends.
Not enough space on internal storage. The required minimum amount of available space is %1$d MB.
Do you really want to cancel the download?
Your device does not support writing to sdcard.
Remove from Playing queue and selected playlists
You need Wi-Fi to connect to a remote server.
Sync is waiting for other background operations to complete.
Checking whether a new USB sync is needed.
Unable to find a web browser
Could not find any Media server on the network.
Sync changed metadata such as ratings and play history.
Sync playlists and new files to the server (folders must be configured on the server).
Auto-sync playlists and new files to the server
Auto-sync playlists and new files to the server + file metadata
Delete local files and playlists that are on the server but not the sync list.
Delete all local files and playlists that aren\'t on the sync list.
Verifies whether previously synced files or playlists have been removed from the server (Slow. Only active for this sync).
Skip the sync review page before syncing. Disable to adjust sync settings before each sync.
The server took too long to process the request.\nRetry, or restart the server if it\'s unavailable.
Preparing list of files to delete…
Click to show confirmation dialog and continue sync…
Please confirm uploads to the server and deletions from this location.
Items to upload to the server
Items to delete from this location
Waiting for the file to convert…
Since this is your first time connecting to the server, you may need to accept the connection on the server in order to proceed.
Synchronization refused due to invalid target file locations(s). Edit the locations on the sync server.
Synchronization refused by remote server.\n Verify that Wi-Fi synchronization is enabled on the remote server.
No storage location is configured to be synced!
Server inaccessible (try restarting the server and then re-running the Sync configuration wizard)
Conversion of %s is stalled. Check free space in the server\'s temp folder.
MediaMonkey is configured to sync with a different server. Do you want to use new sync settings from this server (existing settings will be replaced)?
An unexpected failure occurred during autoconversion of tracks.
An unexpected failure occurred during sync initialization.
To resolve this, we\'ll need your help and additional logs from MediaMonkey for Windows. Please contact us via our helpdesk for instructions.
MediaMonkey sync server is not available. Try connecting to a different sync server.
"If you haven\'t yet installed a MediaMonkey sync server, it can be downloaded via: "
"To sync MediaMonkey for Android, you need to install a MediaMonkey sync server/desktop. See details at: "
Debug logs have been uploaded. Thank you!

Debug logs only contain information related to MediaMonkey functionality: MediaMonkey library information (e.g. track names, location, metadata), configuration data, and usage data. This is used solely for the purpose of improving MediaMonkey software.
MediaMonkey has crashed. Sending a debug log will help us resolve this problem.
Don\'t ask next time and send debug logs automatically
Please refer to this ID when communicating about this issue.
Save a copy of the log ID:
Shares the log ID to email, SMS, etc. for your own records.
Please describe the problem and what triggered it.
This allows us to contact you to solve the problem.
Submit debug logs for a bug report.
If MediaMonkey crashes, debug logs will be sent to the development team automatically. This will take effect after the app is restarted.
Find missing artwork as tracks play.
Skipped %1$s. It is unsupported by the receiver.
Added tracks to the Playing queue
To automatically look up lyrics please consider upgrading.
Find missing lyrics as tracks play.
Update the database with looked up content.
Sorry, the equalizer is not supported on this device.
Equalizer cannot be accessed at the moment.
This requires the %s addon, available at no cost.
To set track as ringtone or alarm, please give MediaMonkey permission to change system settings.
Permission was denied. Track cannot be set as ringtone/alarm.
Choose which folders to include in the library.
Choose which folders to include in the library and correct access permissions.
To perform this operation, the file must be added to the library.
Scan the folder to the library?
Scan library folders to show new/modified content.
%s couldn\'t be found in their expected location .
Manage library folders to add/remove library folders?
It looks like they\'re at %s. Update location?
Save play history to last.fm or other services via one of these apps:
%1$s can\'t be disabled from this app. Do you want uninstall it?
If you\'re enjoying MediaMonkey, would you take a moment to rate it? Thanks for Your support!
Allow notifications for various background processes.
Choose which icons appear on the home screen.
Audio settings, Audio devices, Playing queue
Crossfade adjacent tracks (unstable on some devices).
Uninterrupted playback of consecutive audio tracks.
Prevents notifications from changing volume while playing.
To disable touch sounds, please give MediaMonkey permission to change system settings.
Permission was denied. System touch sounds cannot be disabled.
Respond to bluetooth or other controls whenever possible.
Don\'t automatically resume playback upon connecting an audio device.
Use the home screen\'s hierarchy for browsing over bluetooth or Android Auto.
Limit list size for external apps
Displays %s tracks when browsing via Android Auto, Bluetooth, etc. Values > 0 may be incompatible with some devices.
Use MediaMonkey to play video by default
Plays the track without clearing the Playing queue
Alternate mechanism if cast volume control fails.
Playlist changes made by other apps will appear in the library when it\'s refreshed. Disable if other apps corrupt synced playlists.
End Wi-Fi sync operations on low battery
End Wi-Fi sync if less than %1d %% battery remains.
Wi-Fi Sync ended due to low battery.
Choose a new MediaMonkey server to sync with.
Allow MediaMonkey to run in the background
This prevents Android from closing MediaMonkey when it\'s running (casting, syncing, etc.) in the background.
Change node order by tap-holding and dragging items.
Show as child navigation nodes (e.g. in tabs)
Show as top level navigation nodes (e.g. on the home screen)
Always expand to show background task details.
Subnodes cannot be moved to a new parent.
Displays playback position in the notifications player.
When paused/inactive, run in notifications bar for %1$s before closing.
When paused/inactive, run in notifications bar.
Sharing content with Android Auto/Bluetooth device.
Adjusts volume for tracks with volume information.
Click the 3 dots menu icon on the following dialog.
Select \"Show SD card\" to allow SD card locations to display.
Tap the navigation icon on the left to display all storage locations.
Choose the location you want to grant access to, typically \"SD card\".
A file browser will open the folder requiring access.
Click \"Use this folder\" or \"Select\" to choose the folder.
MediaMonkey requires folder write permission to function optimally!
MediaMonkey can\'t access its application folder. Reboot your device to resolve this.
To use MediaMonkey please give it access to your media files.
If permission is not granted, new content will be saved to a private MediaMonkey folder that can\'t be shared with other apps.
If access isn\'t granted to the requested folders:\n\nMediaMonkey will instead sync content to a MediaMonkey-specific folder that is inaccessible to other music players.
If access isn\'t granted to the requested folders:\n\nMediaMonkey won\'t be able to edit/sync content to those locations!
Path %s was not requested. Please choose from the list above.
Cannot write to the configured location. MediaMonkey-specific folder will be used instead.
Get updated with the latest MediaMonkey beta builds.
The folder is used for USB synchronization with MediaMonkey desktop.
MediaMonkey requires write permissions for backup & USB sync.
Preferences have been restored from backup.
To assign ringtone to contact, please give MediaMonkey required permission.
Permission was denied. The ringtone cannot be assigned to contact.
Permission denied. File is not readable.
To scan videos MediaMonkey needs access to the Android video library.
Tracks have links to artwork that hasn\'t been added to the library. Please add these folders to the library so that artwork displays correctly.
Tracks have links to artwork that cannot be read. Please grant access to this folder %s.
MediaMonkey requires access to media files to work. Please give it access to your media files.

MediaMonkey requires access to media files to work. Unfortunately requests for the permission were denied and it cannot be requested again. To use MediaMonkey go to the application details and grant the permission manually.
Access to media files is blocked because \'All files access\' is disabled for the system app \'External storage\'.

To resolve this: 

 1 Tap 'Configure…' to open the 'All files access' permission settings. 

 2 Find 'External Storage' in the app list, and enable it (if it's not in the list, tap '⋮' > 'Show System Apps').
There is no file manager installed capable of granting folder access.\nPlease install Files by Google.
Tap the \'Create folder\' button, and enter or \'Paste\' the new folder name (MediaMonkey copies the folder name to the clipboard).
This folder is configured as a sync destination (on the sync server) and will be recreated on the next sync operation.
Grab to re-order items in the list
Disable all debug logs to improve performance
Use adaptive colors in the album grid.
